CatDescriptText: Mr. Clyde Hampton, maintenance man, downtown and Miss Barbara Best, job hunter, Aliquippa, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 21, 1962, pg. 17 with question: "Do you approve of the United States testing nuclear weapons in the atmosphere?" Mr. Hampton's answer reads: "Yes, I do.  Other countries are testing.  It's being done for a purpose.  It's best for us to keep ahead of them."  Ms. Best's answer reads: "I do.  We have to do it to catch up with Russia."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Clyde Hampton wearing sunglasses and hat, standing with woman in front of the Brass Rail Restaurant, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Barbara Best wearing plaid sleeveless shirt with ruffles, standing in front of C.C. Mellor's, Smithfield Street, Downtown
